name: presets
label::English: Preset HIV-Malaria prevalence and season

name: Id10002
label::English: Is this a region of high HIV/AIDS prevalence?
hint::English: Should be completed by the central office.HIGH corresponds to >1% of deaths due to HIV/AIDS, LOW around 0.1%, VERY LOW <0.01%. Filling in during the interview is not mandatory. Usually the value is predetermined for the region.

name: Id10003
label::English: Is this a region of high malaria prevalence?
hint::English: Should be completed by the central office.HIGH corresponds to >1% of deaths due to malaria, LOW around 0.1%, VERY LOW <0.01%. Filling in during the interview is not mandatory. Usually the value is predetermined for the region.

name: Id10004
label::English: During which season did (s)he die?

name: respondent_backgr
label::English: Information on the respondent and background about interview

name: Id10007
label::English: What is the name of VA respondent?

name: Id10008
label::English: What is the respondent's relationship to the deceased?
hint::English: First verify if the respondent is a familiy member, and only if it is not a family member choose the other categories like health worker or public official.

name: Id10009
label::English: Did the respondent live with the deceased in the period leading to her/his death?

name: Id10010
label::English: Name of VA interviewer

name: Id10011
label::English: Time at start of interview

name: Id10012
label::English: Date of interview

name: Id10013
label::English: Did the respondent give consent?

name: consented
label::English: Skip to end if not consented

name: deceased_CRVS
label::English: Information about the deceased and vital registration

name: info_on_deceased
label::English: Information on the Deceased

name: Id10017
label::English: What was the first or given name(s) of the deceased?

name: Id10018
label::English:
What was the surname (or family name)
 of the deceased?

name: Id10019
label::English: What was the sex of the deceased?

name: Id10020
label::English: Is the date of birth known?

name: Id10021
label::English: When was the deceased born?
hint::English: To select previous years, click or tap the month name, then click or tap the year.

name: Id10022
label::English: Is the date of death known?

name: Id10023
label::English: When did (s)he die?

name: Id10024
label::English: Please indicate the year of death.

name: displayAgeNeonate
label::English: NEONATE was ${ageInDays} days old.
hint::English: Please verify that the age is correct, before you proceed. You will now be filling in the questionnaire for a NEONATE

name: displayAgeChild
label::English: CHILD was ${ageInYears} years ${ageInMonths} months and ${ageInMonthsRemain} days old.
hint::English: Please verify that the age is correct, before you proceed. You will now be filling in the questionnaire for a CHILD

name: displayAgeAdult
label::English: ADULT was ${ageInYears} years old.
hint::English: Please verify that the age is correct, before you proceed. You will now be filling in the questionnaire for an ADULT

name: age_group
label::English: What age group corresponds to the deceased?
hint::English: (1) Neonatal 0-28 completed days; (2) Child 29 days - 11 years; (3) Adult - above 11 years

name: age_neonate_days
label::English: Enter neonate's age in days:
constraint_message::English: Neonatal age is 0 to 27 days only!

name: age_neonate_hours
label::English: Enter neonate's age in hours:

name: age_neonate_minutes
label::English: Enter neonate's age in minutes:

name: age_child_unit
label::English: Enter child's age in:

name: age_child_days
label::English: Enter child's age in days:
constraint_message::English: Child's age is between 28 days and 11 years only!

name: age_child_months
label::English: Enter child's age in months:
constraint_message::English: Child's age is between 28 days and 11 years only!

name: age_child_years
label::English: Enter child's age in years:
constraint_message::English: Child's age is between 28 days and 11 years only!

name: age_adult
label::English: Enter adult's age in years:
constraint_message::English: Adult age is above 11 years only!

name: Id10058
label::English: Where did the deceased die?

name: Id10051
label::English: Is there a need to collect civil registration data on the deceased?
hint::English: If you choose 'No', this question allows to skip asking details about place of residence, education and family. The question on marriage status will always be asked for adults.

name: Id10052
label::English: What was her/his citizenship/nationality?

name: Id10053
label::English: What was her/his ethnicity?
hint::English: Enter a “-“ if this information is not available.

name: Id10054
label::English: What was her/his place of birth?
hint::English: Specify here village and district, a question on the facility and circumstances will be asked later.  Enter a “-“ if this information is not available.

name: Id10055
label::English: What was her/his place of usual residence? (the place where the person lived most of the year)
hint::English: for perinatal cases just ask for the address of the health facility or if released at home the home address

name: Id10056
label::English: What was her/his place of normal residence 1 to 5 years before death?

name: Id10057
label::English: Where did death occur? (specify country, province, district, village)

name: Id10059
label::English: What was her/his marital status?
hint::English: Life partner is defined here as living with someone for a long time without ever having married.

name: Id10060
label::English: What was the date of marriage?

name: Id10061
label::English: What was the name of the father?

name: Id10062
label::English: What was the name of the mother?

name: Id10063
label::English: What was her/his highest level of schooling?

name: Id10064
label::English: Was (s)he able to read and write?
hint::English: select 'yes' also if only one of either reading or writing is known to the respondent

name: Id10065
label::English: What was her/his economic activity status in year prior to death?
hint::English: The deceased might have had several activities.  Choose the one that was probabaly true for most of the year preceding illness and death

name: Id10066
label::English: What was her/his occupation, that is, what kind of work did (s)he mainly do?

name: vital_reg_certif
label::English: Civil registration numbers

name: Id10069
label::English: Is there a need to collect civil registration numbers on the deceased?
hint::English: Enter a “-“ if this information is not available.

name: Id10070
label::English: Death registration number/certificate
hint::English: Enter a “-“ if this information is not available.

name: Id10071
label::English: Date of registration

name: Id10072
label::English: Place of registration
hint::English: Enter a “-“ if this information is not available.

name: Id10073
label::English: National identification number of deceased
hint::English: Enter a “-“ if this information is not available. For children and newborn that have no ID number, use thone of the parents.

name: injuries_accidents
label::English: History of injuries/accidents

name: Id10077
label::English: Did (s)he suffer from any injury or accident that led to her/his death?

name: injuries_accidents_yes
label::English: Injuries and accidents detail

name: Id10079
label::English: Was it a road traffic accident?

name: Id10080
label::English: What was her/his role in the road traffic accident?

name: Id10081
label::English: What was the counterpart that was hit during the road traffic accident?

name: Id10082
label::English: Was (s)he injured in a non-road transport accident?

name: Id10083
label::English: Was (s)he injured in a fall?

name: Id10084
label::English: Was there any poisoning?
hint::English: This includes accidents and cases where it is unkown if it was an accident or whether there was intentional violence

name: Id10085
label::English: Did (s)he die of drowning?

name: Id10086
label::English: Was (s)he injured by a bite or sting by venomous animal?
hint::English: This includes accidents and cases where it is unkown if it was an accident or whether there was intentional violence

name: Id10087
label::English: Was (s)he injured by an animal or insect (non-venomous)?

name: Id10088
label::English: What was the animal/insect?

name: Id10089
label::English: Was (s)he injured by burns/fire?

name: Id10090
label::English: Was (s)he subject to violence (suicide, homicide, abuse)?
hint::English: (don't say suicide for under-10-year olds)

name: Id10091
label::English: Was (s)he injured by a fire arm?

name: Id10092
label::English: Was (s)he stabbed, cut or pierced?

name: Id10093
label::English: Was (s)he strangled?

name: Id10094
label::English: Was (s)he injured by a blunt force?

name: Id10095
label::English: Was (s)he injured by a force of nature?

name: Id10096
label::English: Was it electrocution?
hint::English: This includes accidents and cases where it is unkown if it was an accident or whether there was intentional violence

name: Id10097
label::English: Did (s)he encounter any other injury?

name: Id10098
label::English: Was the injury accidental?

name: Id10099
label::English: Was the injury or accident self-inflicted?

name: Id10100
label::English: Was the injury or accident intentionally inflicted by someone else?

name: stillbirth
label::English: Verification of possible stillbirth

name: Id10104
label::English: Did the baby ever cry?

name: Id10105
label::English: Did the baby cry immediately after birth, even if only a little bit?

name: Id10106
label::English: How many minutes after birth did the baby first cry? (use 999 for never)

name: Id10107
label::English: Did the baby stop being able to cry?

name: Id10108
label::English: How many hours before death did the baby stop crying?

name: Id10109
label::English: Did the baby ever move?

name: Id10110
label::English: Did the baby ever breathe?

name: Id10111
label::English: Did the baby breathe immediately after birth, even a little?

name: Id10112
label::English: Did the baby have a breating problem?

name: Id10113
label::English: Was the baby given assistance to breathe at birth?

name: Id10114
label::English: If the baby didn't show any sign of life, was it born dead?
hint::English: This question serves to finally determine if the baby was born alive or dead.

name: Id10115
label::English: Were there any bruises or signs of injury on baby's body after the birth?

name: Id10116
label::English: Was the baby’s body soft, pulpy and discoloured and the skin peeling away?
hint::English: Macerated means the body was pulpy. This indicates that the baby has been dead inside the mother for some time.  If the deceased is ascertained to be a stillbirth, proceed straight with the injury section.

name: illhistory
label::English: Health history

name: Id10351
label::English: How old was the baby when the fatal illness started?
hint::English: The answer could be in months or days, but for data entry convert in days. Less than 24 hours = 0 days

name: Id10408
label::English: Before the illness that led to death, was the baby/the child growing normally?

name: illdur
label::English: Duration of illness

name: illdurnote
label::English: For how long was (s)he ill before death?

name: Id10120
label::English: Days
hint::English: Less than 24 hours = 0 days. If more then 28 days, enter duration in months in the next question.

name: Id10122
label::English: Weeks

name: Id10121
label::English: Months
hint::English: Not applicable for newborn.   If duration given is more then one month, need to verify agin age at death.

name: Id10123
label::English: Did (s)he die suddenly?

name: med_hist_final_illness
label::English: Medical history associated with final illness

name: Id10125
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of tuberculosis?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10126
label::English: Was the HIV test ever positive?

name: Id10127
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of AIDS?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10128
label::English: Did (s)he have a recent positive test by a health professional for malaria?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10129
label::English: Did (s)he have a recent negative test by a health professional for malaria?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10130
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of dengue fever?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10131
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of measles?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10132
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of high blood pressure?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10133
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of heart disease?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10134
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of diabetes?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10135
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of asthma?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10136
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of epilepsy?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10137
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of cancer?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10138
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10139
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of dementia?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10140
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of depression?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10141
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of stroke?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10142
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of sickle cell disease?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10143
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of kidney disease?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: Id10144
label::English: Was there any diagnosis by a health professional of liver disease?
hint::English: remind the respondent that we are asking for the diagnosis assessed by a doctor, health worker, or other health professional during the final illness

name: signs_symptoms_final_illness
label::English: General signs and symptoms associated with final illness

name: Id10147
label::English: Did (s)he have a fever?

name: Id10148
label::English: How many days did the fever last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 week = 7 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10149
label::English: Did the fever continue until death?

name: Id10150
label::English: How severe was the fever?

name: Id10151
label::English: What was the pattern of the fever?

name: Id10152
label::English: Did (s)he have night sweats?

name: Id10153
label::English: Did (s)he have a cough?

name: Id10154
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have a cough?

name: Id10155
label::English: Was the cough productive, with sputum?

name: Id10156
label::English: Was the cough very severe?

name: Id10157
label::English: Did (s)he cough up blood?

name: Id10158
label::English: Did (s)he make a whooping sound when coughing?
relevant: ((selected(${isChild}, '1') or selected(${isAdult}, '1')) and selected(${Id10153}, 'yes')) or (selected(${isNeonatal}, '1') and  selected(${Id10114}, 'no'))

name: Id10159
label::English: Did (s)he have any difficulty breathing?

name: breathdur
label::English: Duration of breathing difficulty

name: Id10161
label::English: For how many days did the difficulty breathing last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10162
label::English: For how many months did the difficulty breathing last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10163
label::English: For how many years did the difficulty breathing last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10165
label::English: Was the difficulty continuous or on and off?

name: Id10166
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did (s)he have fast breathing?

name: Id10167
label::English: For how many days did the fast breathing last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10168
label::English: Did (s)he have breathlessness?

name: Id10169
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have breathlessness?

name: Id10170
label::English: Was (s)he unable to carry out daily routines due to breathlessness?

name: Id10171
label::English: Was (s)he breathless while lying flat?

name: Id10172
label::English: Did you see the lower chest wall/ribs being pulled in as the child breathed in?
hint::English: Ask only for children under the age of 12 years. Show photos.

name: Id10173
label::English: During the illness that led to death did his/her breathing sound like any of the following:
hint::English: "In case of adults demonstrate wheezing sound only because stridor and grunting is extremely rare in adults”. Ask about stridor and grunting only for children under the age of 12 years. Demonstrate each sound, in doubt select multiple.

name: Id10174
label::English: Did (s)he have chest pain?

name: Id10175
label::English: Was the chest pain severe?

name: Id10176
label::English: How many days before death did (s)he have chest pain?

name: paindur
label::English: Duration of the chest pain

name: Id10178
label::English: How many minutes did the pain last?
hint::English: enter minutes and hours as appropriate

name: Id10179
label::English: How many hours did the pain last?

name: Id10181
label::English: Did (s)he have more frequent loose or liquid stools than usual?
hint::English: Enquire the respondent about his/her understanding of what is diarrhoea(having more frequent loose or liquid stools than usual); if unclear or wrong, explain to the respondent what is diarrhoea .

name: Id10182
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have frequent loose or liquid stools?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 week = 7 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10183
label::English: How many stools did the baby or child have on the day that loose liquid stools were most frequent?
hint::English: Enter “999“ if this information is not known.

name: Id10184
label::English: How many days before death did the frequent loose or liquid stools start?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”.  Enter “999“ if this information is not known.

name: Id10185
label::English: Did the frequent loose or liquid stools continue until death?

name: Id10186
label::English: At any time during the final illness was there blood in the stools?

name: Id10187
label::English: Was there blood in the stool up until death?

name: Id10188
label::English: Did (s)he vomit?

name: Id10189
label::English: Did (s)he vomit in the week preceding the death?

name: Id10190
label::English: For how many days before death did (s)he vomit?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10191
label::English: Was there blood in the vomit?

name: Id10192
label::English: Was the vomit black?

name: Id10193
label::English: Did (s)he have any belly (abdominal) problem?
hint::English: Explain to the respondent that problems could be pain, protruding abdomen or a mass.

name: Id10194
label::English: Did (s)he have belly (abdominal) pain?

name: Id10195
label::English: Was the belly (abdominal) pain severe?

name: abdominal_pain
label::English: Belly pain

name: a_pain_how_long
label::English: For how long before death did (s)he have belly (abdominal) pain?

name: Id10196
label::English: Hours

name: Id10197
label::English: Days

name: Id10197b
label::English: Weeks

name: Id10198
label::English: Months

name: Id10199
label::English: Was the pain in the upper or lower belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10200
label::English: Did (s)he have a more than usually protruding belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10201
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have a more than usually protruding belly (abdomen)?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 week = 7 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10202
label::English: For how many months did (s)he have a more than usually protruding belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10203
label::English: How rapidly did (s)he develop the protruding belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10204
label::English: Did (s)he have any mass in the belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10205
label::English: For how many days before death did (s)he have a mass in the belly (abdomen)?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. 1 week= 7 days. 1 month=30 days

name: Id10206
label::English: For how many months before death did (s)he have a mass in the belly (abdomen)?

name: Id10207
label::English: Did (s)he have a severe headache?

name: Id10208
label::English: Did (s)he have a stiff neck during illness that led to death?

name: Id10209
label::English: For how many days before death did (s)he have stiff neck?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. 1 week= 7 days. 1 month=30 days

name: Id10210
label::English: Did (s)he have a painful neck during the illness that led to death?

name: Id10211
label::English: For how many days before death did (s)he have a painful neck?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. 1 week= 7 days. 1 month=30 days

name: Id10212
label::English: Did (s)he have mental confusion?

name: Id10213
label::English: For how many months did (s)he have mental confusion?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 month= 30 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10214
label::English: Was (s)he unconscious during the illness that lead to death?

name: Id10215
label::English: Was (s)he unconscious for more than 24 hours before death?

name: Id10216
label::English: How many hours before death did unconsciousness start?
hint::English: The question needs input in hours but the respondent may not know exactly and so it may be easier to ask 'how long' and then convert the duration in hours. (Less than 1 hour = "0")

name: Id10217
label::English: Did the unconsciousness start suddenly, quickly (at least within a single day)?

name: Id10218
label::English: Did the unconsciousness continue until death?

name: Id10219
label::English: Did (s)he have convulsions?

name: Id10220
label::English: Did (s)he experience any generalized convulsions or fits during the illness that led to death?

name: Id10221
label::English: For how many minutes did the convulsions last?
hint::English: Less than 1 minute = "0". Use 1 hour=60 minutes to determine the number of minutes

name: Id10222
label::English: Did (s)he become unconscious immediately after the convulsion?

name: Id10223
label::English: Did (s)he have any urine problems?
hint::English: Explain to the respondent that urine problems refer to urinating a lot or not at all, and blood in the urine.

name: Id10224
label::English: Did (s)he stop urinating?
hint::English: This means that the deceased stopped urinating

name: Id10225
label::English: Did (s)he go to urinate more often than usual?

name: Id10226
label::English: During the final illness did (s)he ever pass blood in the urine?

name: Id10227
label::English: Did (s)he have sores or ulcers anywhere on the body?

name: Id10228
label::English: Did (s)he have sores?

name: Id10229
label::English: Did the sores have clear fluid or pus?

name: Id10230
label::English: Did (s)he have an ulcer (pit) on the foot?

name: Id10231
label::English: Did the ulcer on the foot ooze pus?

name: Id10232
label::English: For how many days did the ulcer on the foot ooze pus?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”

name: Id10233
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did (s)he have any skin rash?

name: Id10234
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have the skin rash?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 week=7 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10235
label::English: Where was the rash?

name: Id10236
label::English: Did (s)he have measles rash (use local term)?

name: Id10237
label::English: Did (s)he ever have shingles or herpes zoster?

name: Id10238
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did her/his skin flake off in patches?

name: Id10239
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did he/she have areas of the skin that turned black?

name: Id10240
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did he/she have areas of the skin with redness and swelling?

name: Id10241
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did (s)he bleed from anywhere?

name: Id10242
label::English: Did (s)he bleed from the nose, mouth or anus?

name: Id10243
label::English: Did (s)he have noticeable weight loss?

name: Id10244
label::English: Was (s)he severely thin or wasted?

name: Id10245
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did s/he have a whitish rash inside the mouth or on the tongue?

name: Id10246
label::English: Did (s)he have stiffness of the whole body or was unable to open the mouth?

name: Id10247
label::English: Did (s)he have puffiness of the face?

name: Id10248
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have puffiness of the face?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 month= 7 days or 1 month=30 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10249
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did (s)he have swollen legs or feet?

name: Id10250
label::English: How many days did the swelling last?
hint::English: Less than 1 day= “0”. Use 1 week=7 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10251
label::English: Did (s)he have both feet swollen?

name: Id10252
label::English: Did (s)he have general puffiness all over hi(s)her body?

name: Id10253
label::English: Did (s)he have any lumps?

name: Id10254
label::English: Did (s)he have any lumps or lesions in the mouth?

name: Id10255
label::English: Did (s)he have any lumps on the neck?

name: Id10256
label::English: Did (s)he have any lumps on the armpit?

name: Id10257
label::English: Did (s)he have any lumps on the groin?

name: Id10258
label::English: Was (s)he in any way paralysed?

name: Id10259
label::English: Did s(he have paralysis of only one side of the body?

name: Id10260
label::English: Which were the limbs or body parts paralysed?

name: Id10261
label::English: Did (s)he have difficulty swallowing?

name: Id10262
label::English: For how many days before death did (s)he have difficulty swallowing?
hint::English: Less than 1 day=“0”. Use 1 month=30 days or 1 month=30 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10263
label::English: Was the difficulty with swallowing with solids, liquids, or both?

name: Id10264
label::English: Did (s)he have pain upon swallowing?

name: Id10265
label::English: Did (s)he have yellow discoloration of the eyes?

name: Id10266
label::English: For how many days did (s)he have the yellow discoloration?
hint::English: Less than 1 day=“0”. Use 1 month=30 days or 1 month=30 days to determine the number of days

name: Id10267
label::English: Did her/his hair change in color to a reddish or yellowish color?

name: Id10268
label::English: Did (s)he look pale (thinning/lack of blood) or have pale palms, eyes or nail beds?
hint::English: Long term deficiency of the blood results in a pale, whitish appearance of the lips, tongue, and eye sac. Sometime it is referred to as thinning or lack of blood, or pallor.

name: Id10269
label::English: Did (s)he have sunken eyes?

name: Id10270
label::English: Did (s)he drink a lot more water than usual?

name: Id10271
label::English: Was the baby able to suckle or bottle-feed within the first 24 hours after birth?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10272
label::English: Did the baby ever suckle in a normal way?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10273
label::English: Did the baby stop suckling?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10274
label::English: How many days after birth did the baby stop suckling?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10275
label::English: Did the baby have convulsions starting within the first 24 hours of life?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10276
label::English: Did the baby have convulsions starting more than 24 hours after birth?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10277
label::English: Did the baby's body become stiff, with the back arched backwards?
hint::English: This question should be asked only if the child was <1 year old when it died.

name: Id10278
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby have a bulging or raised fontanelle? (ask only up to 18 months)
hint::English: Show photo

name: Id10279
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby have a sunken fontanelle? (ask only up to 18 months)
hint::English: Show photo

name: Id10281
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby become unresponsive or unconscious?

name: Id10282
label::English: Did the baby become unresponsive or unconscious soon after birth, within less than 24 hours?

name: Id10283
label::English: Did the baby become unresponsive or unconscious more than 24 hours after birth?
relevant: ((selected(${Id10281}, 'yes') and not(selected(${Id10282}, 'yes')) and (selected(${isNeonatal}, '1')) and ${Id10114}!='yes') or selected(${isChild}, '1'))

name: neonatal_childC
label::English: Neonatal child questions part C

name: Id10284
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby become cold to touch?

name: Id10285
label::English: How many days old was the baby when it started feeling cold to touch?

name: Id10286
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby become lethargic, after a period of normal activity?

name: Id10287
label::English: Did the baby have redness or pus drainage from the umbilical cord stump?

name: Id10288
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby have skin ulcer(s) or pits?

name: Id10289
label::English: During the illness that led to death, did the baby have yellow skin, palms (hand) or soles (foot)?

name: Id10290
label::English: Did the baby or infant appear to be healthy and then just die suddenly?

name: pregnancy_women
label::English: Signs and symptoms associated with pregnancy and women

name: Id10294
label::English: Did she have any swelling or lump in the breast?

name: Id10295
label::English: Did she have any ulcers (pits) in the breast?

name: Id10296
label::English: Did she ever have a period or menstruate?
hint::English: Ask for period and menstruation, and also mention the content of the subquestions already (excessive quantity or little quantity of bleeding, or irregular vaginal bleeding). If anything is mentioned select yes.

name: Id10297
label::English: Did she have  vaginal bleeding in between menstrual periods?
hint::English: Important is the excessive quantity of blood

name: Id10298
label::English: Was the bleeding excessive?

name: Id10299
label::English: Did her menstrual period stop naturally because of menopause?
hint::English: If woman was under 40, do not ask and just click ‘No’.

name: Id10300
label::English: Did she have vaginal bleeding after cessation of menstruation?
hint::English: If woman was under 40, do not ask and just click ‘No’.

name: Id10301
label::English: Was there excessive vaginal bleeding in the week prior to death?
hint::English: Important is the excessive quantity of blood

name: Id10302
label::English: At the time of death was her period overdue?

name: Id10303
label::English: For how many weeks had her period been overdue?

name: Id10304
label::English: Did she have a sharp pain in her belly (abdomen) shortly before death?

name: Id10305
label::English: Was she pregnant at the time of death?

name: Id10306
label::English: Did she die within 6 weeks of delivery, abortion or miscarriage?

name: Id10307
label::English: Did this woman die more than 42 days after being pregnant or delivering a baby?

name: Id10308
label::English: Was this a woman who died less than 1 year after being pregnant or delivering a baby?

name: Id10309
label::English: For how many months was she pregnant?
hint::English: Important is the distinction beween early and late pregnancy (threshold is 6 months)

name: Id10310
label::English: Please confirm: When she died, she was NEITHER pregnant NOR had recently been pregnant NOR had recently delivered when she died - is that right?
hint::English: "Recently" here means 6 weeks. This questions serves to confirm that no maternal death is missed.

name: group_maternal
label::English: Questions about possible maternal deaths

name: Id10312
label::English: Did she die during labour or delivery?
hint::English: Labor is the period of time by which contractions are less than 10 minutes apart.

name: Id10313
label::English: Did she die after delivering a baby?

name: Id10314
label::English: Did she die within 24 hours after delivery?

name: Id10315
label::English: Did she die within 6 weeks of childbirth?

name: Id10316
label::English: Did she give birth to a live baby (within 6 weeks of her death)?
hint::English: The important aspect is if the baby was alive.

name: Id10317
label::English: Did she die during or after a multiple pregnancy?

name: Id10318
label::English: Was she breastfeeding the child in the days before death?

name: Id10319
label::English: How many births, including stillbirths, did she/the mother have before this baby?

name: Id10320
label::English: Had she had any previous Caesarean section?

name: Id10321
label::English: During pregnancy, did she suffer from high blood pressure?

name: Id10322
label::English: Did she have foul smelling vaginal discharge during pregnancy or after delivery?

name: Id10323
label::English: During the last 3 months of pregnancy, did she suffer from convulsions?

name: Id10324
label::English: During the last 3 months of pregnancy did she suffer from blurred vision?

name: Id10325
label::English: Did bleeding occur while she was pregnant

name: Id10326
label::English: Was there vaginal bleeding during the first 6 months of pregnancy?

name: Id10327
label::English: Was there vaginal bleeding during the last 3 months of pregnancy but before labour started?
hint::English: Make sure the respondent understands that it is important that this bleeding happened before birth

name: Id10328
label::English: Did she have excessive bleeding during labour or delivery?
hint::English: Here the excessive quantity of blood DURING birth is what we ask for

name: Id10329
label::English: Did she have excessive bleeding after delivery or abortion?
hint::English: Here the excessive quantity of blood AFTER birth is what we ask for

name: Id10330
label::English: Was the placenta completely delivered?

name: Id10331
label::English: Did she deliver or try to deliver an abnormally positioned baby?
hint::English: Enquire the respondent about his/hers understanding of what is an abnormally positioned baby; if unclear or wrong, explain that it refers to babys' whose first body part exiting the vagina is not the head.

name: Id10332
label::English: For how many hours was she in labour?
hint::English: Less than 1 hour= “0”

name: Id10333
label::English: Did she attempt to terminate the pregnancy?

name: Id10334
label::English: Did she recently have a pregnancy that ended in an abortion (spontaneous or induced)?

name: Id10335
label::English: Did she die during an abortion?

name: Id10336
label::English: Did she die within 6 weeks of having an abortion?

name: Id10337
label::English: Where did she give birth?

name: Id10338
label::English: Did she receive professional assistance during the delivery?
hint::English: Explain to the respondent what is meant by a professional assistance: delivery attended by a medical professional (doctor, nurse or midwife).

name: Id10339
label::English: Who delivered the baby?

name: Id10340
label::English: Did she have an operation to remove her uterus shortly before death?

name: deliverytype
label::English: How did the mother deliver her baby?

name: Id10342
label::English: Was the delivery normal vaginal, without forceps or vacuum?

name: Id10343
label::English: Was the delivery vaginal, with forceps or vacuum?

name: Id10344
label::English: Was the delivery a Caesarean section?

name: Id10347
label::English: Was the baby born more than one month early?

name: neonatal_child
label::English: Neonatal and child history, signs and symptoms

name: Id10352
label::English: How many years old was the child when the fatal illness started?

name: neonatal_childA
label::English: Neonatal child questions part A

name: Id10354
label::English: Was the child part of a multiple  birth?
hint::English: If two or more children are born at the same time, it is counted as a multiple birth, even if one or more of the babies are born dead.

name: Id10355
label::English: Was the child the first, second, or later in the birth order?

name: Id10356
label::English: Is the mother still alive?
hint::English: If mother is present at the interview, select 'yes' without asking the question aloud.

name: Id10357
label::English: Did the mother die during or after the delivery?

name: moth_death
label::English: Time between delivery and death of mother

name: Id10358
label::English: How many months after the delivery did the mother die?
hint::English: The respondent may reply in months and days. Enter the number of monts and days given. The sum of the number of months and days you enter should reflect the time interval given by the respondent. If the interval was less then one month, enter '0' here

name: Id10359
label::English: How many days after the delivery did the mother die?

name: Id10360
label::English: Where was the deceased born?
hint::English: Read the question and slowly read the first 5 choices.   Respondent should hear all 5 choices and then respond.

name: Id10361
label::English: Did the mother receive professional assistance during the delivery? (ask only up to 1 year)
hint::English: Explain to the respondent what is meant by a professional assistance: delivery attended by a medical professional (doctor, nurse or midwife).

name: Id10362
label::English: At birth, was the baby of usual size?
hint::English: Show photos, explain to the respondent that even if the aswer is "no" some more questions will be asked, just to make sure no important detail has been missed.

name: Id10363
label::English: At birth, was the baby smaller than usual, (weighing under 2.5 kg)?
hint::English: Show photos.

name: Id10364
label::English: At birth, was the baby very much smaller than usual, (weighing under 1 kg)?
hint::English: Show photos.

name: Id10365
label::English: At birth, was the baby larger than usual, (weighing over 4.5 kg)?
hint::English: Show photos.

name: Id10366
label::English: What was the weight (in grammes) of the deceased at birth?
hint::English: Respondents may give the answer in kilograms.  For the data entry, convert to grammes.If don't know enter 8888

name: Id10367
label::English: How many months long was the pregnancy before the child was born? (ask only up to 1 year)
hint::English: If don't know enter 88

name: Id10368
label::English: Were there any complications in the late part of the pregnancy (defined as the last 3 months, before labour)? (ask only up to 1 year)

name: Id10369
label::English: Were there any complications during labour or delivery? (ask only up to 1 year)

name: Id10370
label::English: Was any part of the baby physically abnormal at time of delivery? (for example: body part too large or too small, additional growth on body)?
hint::English: Explain to the respondent that even if the answer is "no" some more questions will be asked, just to make sure no important detail has been missed.

name: Id10371
label::English: Did the baby/ child have a swelling or defect on the back at time of birth?

name: Id10372
label::English: Did the baby/ child have a very large head at time of birth?

name: Id10373
label::English: Did the baby/ child have a very small head at time of birth?

name: neonatal_childB
label::English: Neonatal child questions part B

name: Id10376
label::English: Was the baby moving in the last few days before the birth?

name: Id10377
label::English: Did the baby stop moving in the womb before labour started?

name: babmove
label::English: Baby moving

name: Id10379
label::English: How many days before labour did you or the mother last feel the baby move? (maybe the respondent or health worker had examined the mother)
hint::English: Enter duration as appropriate in hours and days

name: Id10380
label::English: How many hours before labour did you or the mother last feel the baby move? (maybe the respondent or health worker had examined the mother)

name: Id10382
label::English: How many hours did labour and delivery take?
hint::English: If less than on hour enter 0

name: Id10383
label::English: Was the baby born 24 hours or more after the water broke?

name: Id10384
label::English: Was the liquor foul smelling?

name: Id10385
label::English: What was the colour of the liquor when the water broke?

name: mother_deliv
label::English: How was the baby delivered?

name: Id10387
label::English: Was the delivery normal vaginal, without forceps or vacuum?

name: Id10388
label::English: Was the delivery vaginal, with forceps or vacuum?

name: Id10389
label::English: Was the delivery a Caesarean section?

name: Id10391
label::English: Did you/the mother receive any vaccinations since reaching adulthood including during this pregnancy?

name: Id10392
label::English: How many doses?

name: Id10393
label::English: Did the mother receive tetanus toxoid (TT) vaccine?

name: Id10394
label::English: How many births, including stillbirths, did the baby's mother have before this baby?

name: Id10395
label::English: During labour, did the baby's mother suffer from fever?

name: Id10396
label::English: During the last 3 months of pregnancy, labour or delivery, did the baby's mother suffer from high blood pressure?

name: Id10397
label::English: Did the baby's mother have diabetes mellitus?

name: Id10398
label::English: Did the baby's mother have foul smelling vaginal discharge during pregnancy or after delivery?

name: Id10399
label::English: During the last 3 months of pregnancy, labour or delivery, did the baby's mother suffer from convulsions?

name: Id10400
label::English: During the last 3 months of pregnancy did the baby's mother suffer from blurred vision?

name: Id10401
label::English: Did the baby's mother have severe anemia?

name: Id10402
label::English: Did the baby's mother have vaginal bleeding during the last 3 months of pregnancy but before labour started?

name: Id10403
label::English: Did the baby's bottom, feet, arm or hand come out of the vagina before its head?

name: Id10404
label::English: Was the umbilical cord wrapped more than once around the neck of the child at birth?

name: Id10405
label::English: Was the umbilical cord delivered first?

name: Id10406
label::English: Was the baby blue in colour at birth?

name: risk_factors
label::English: Risk factors

name: Id10411
label::English: Did (s)he drink alcohol?

name: Id10412
label::English: Did (s)he use tobacco?

name: Id10413
label::English: Did (s)he smoke tobacco (cigarette, cigar, pipe, etc.)?

name: Id10414
label::English: What kind of tobacco did (s)he use ?

name: Id10415
label::English: How many cigarettes did (s)he smoke daily?

name: health_service_utilization
label::English: Health service utilisation

name: Id10418
label::English: Did (s)he receive any treatment for the illness that led to death?

name: Id10419
label::English: Did (s)he receive oral rehydration salts?

name: Id10420
label::English: Did (s)he receive (or need) intravenous fluids (drip) treatment?

name: Id10421
label::English: Did (s)he receive (or need) a blood transfusion?

name: Id10422
label::English: Did (s)he receive (or need) treatment/food through a tube passed through the nose?

name: Id10423
label::English: Did (s)he receive (or need) injectable antibiotics?

name: Id10424
label::English: Did (s)he receive (or need) antiretroviral therapy (ART)?

name: Id10425
label::English: Did (s)he have (or need) an operation for the illness?

name: Id10426
label::English: Did (s)he have the operation within 1 month before death?

name: Id10427
label::English: Was (s)he discharged from hospital very ill?

name: Id10428
label::English: Had (s)he received immunization?

name: Id10429
label::English: Do you have the child's vaccination card?

name: Id10430
label::English: Can I see the vaccination card (note the vaccines the child received)?
hint::English: Only fill in the vaccination sheet if the respondent has the vaccination card at the present moment during the VA interview; the interviewer should fill in the vaccination sheet, not the respondent.

name: Id10431
label::English: Note vaccines here

name: Id10432
label::English: Was care sought outside the home while (s)he had this illness?

name: Id10433
label::English: Where or from whom did you seek care?

name: Id10434
label::English: Record the name and address of any hospital, health center or clinic where care was sought

name: Id10435
label::English: Did a health care worker tell you the cause of death?

name: Id10436
label::English: What did the health care worker say?

name: Id10437
label::English: Do you have any health records that belonged to the deceased?

name: Id10438
label::English: Can I see the health records?

name: Id10439
label::English: Record the date of the most recent (last) visit

name: Id10440
label::English: Record the date of the last but one (second last) visit

name: Id10441
label::English: Record the date of the last note on the health records

name: Id10442
label::English: Record the weight (in kilogrammes) written at the most recent (last) visit
hint::English: (enter e.g. 3.5)

name: Id10443
label::English: Record the weight (in kilogrammes) written at the last but one (second last) visit

name: Id10444
label::English: Transcribe the last note on the health records

name: Id10445
label::English: Has the deceased’s (biological) mother ever been tested for HIV?

name: Id10446
label::English: Has the deceased’s (biological) mother ever been told she had HIV/AIDS by a health worker?

name: back_context
label::English: Background and context

name: Id10450
label::English: In the final days before death, did s/he travel to a hospital or health facility?

name: Id10451
label::English: Did (s)he use motorised transport to get to the hospital or health facility?

name: Id10452
label::English: Were there any problems during admission to the hospital or health facility?

name: Id10453
label::English: Were there any problems with the way (s)he was treated (medical treatment, procedures, interpersonal attitudes, respect, dignity) in the hospital or health facility?

name: Id10454
label::English: Were there any problems getting medications, or diagnostic tests in the hospital or health facility?

name: Id10455
label::English: Does it take more than 2 hours to get to the nearest hospital or health facility from the deceased's household?

name: Id10456
label::English: In the final days before death, were there any doubts about whether medical care was needed?

name: Id10457
label::English: In the final days before death, was traditional medicine used?

name: Id10458
label::English: In the final days before death, did anyone use a telephone or cell phone to call for help?

name: Id10459
label::English: Over the course of illness, did the total costs of care and treatment prohibit other household payments?

name: deathcert
label::English: Death certificate with cause of death

name: Id10462
label::English: Was a death certificate issued?
hint::English: The following information serves only to complete cause of death information in some environments. In routine CRVS they could be skipped in the interview, and information be collected from other sources, if available.

name: Id10463
label::English: Can I see the death certificate?
hint::English: Fill in the following questions only if you are shown the copy of the certificate.  Do not fill in just based on oral statements.

name: Id10464
label::English: Record the immediate cause of death from the certificate (line 1a)
hint::English: An antecedent cause is the one that caused the one on the line above, e.g. diabetes mellitus may be an antecedent cause to kidney disease.

name: Id10465
label::English: Duration (Ia):

name: Id10466
label::English: Record the first antecedent cause of death from the certificate  (line 1b)
hint::English: For all following lines, add duration, if stated.

name: Id10467
label::English: Duration (Ib):

name: Id10468
label::English: Record the second antecedent cause of death from the certificate (line 1c)

name: Id10469
label::English: Duration (Ic):

name: Id10470
label::English: Record the third antecedent cause of death from the certificate (line 1d)

name: Id10471
label::English: Duration (Id):

name: Id10472
label::English: Record the contributing cause(s) of death from the certificate (part 2)

name: Id10473
label::English: Duration (part2):

name: narrat
label::English: Open narrative

name: Id10476
label::English: NARRATIVE DESCRIPTION

name: Id10477
label::English: Are there any of the following words of interest mentioned in the above narrative?

name: Id10478
label::English: Are there any of the following words of interest mentioned in the above narrative?

name: Id10479
label::English: Are there any of the following words of interest mentioned in the above narrative?

name: Id10481
label::English: Time at end of interview
End of consented group
